Introduction to Anglo-American Law (US a: This course, Introduction to Anglo-American Law, covers fundamental aspects of law in the US and UK, suitable for international students and lawyers. It's a self-study course that covers six areas: law characteristics, sources, court systems, legal terminology, and jurisdiction. The course discusses informal norms, law characteristics, and different kinds of laws, including public and private law. It also introduces the court system in the US and UK, explains how to read and brief a case, and discusses jurisdiction.
